除了文字，目前网络上流动最多的应该是图片了。所以有blog就有photo blog（图片blog），有MSN Messenger，就有图片IM（即时通讯）。photo blog是让你把图片放到网页上，所有的网上冲浪者都可以看到，而图片IM则是让你和朋友们方便的共享照片。如果一款软件结合了photo blog和IM，是不是更有用呢？ Hello就是这样一款软件。首先，它是免费的。其次，Hello用起来也特别简单明了。如果你只想和朋友们分享你的照片，那安装以后通过email邀请你的朋友，你的朋友安装Hello软件后，你们就可以互相分享各自的快乐了。如果你还想把一些图片（加上自己的一些观点）放到网上的话，那Hello软件结合了blogger.com的功能。如果你已经在blogger.com上有账号，那么直接使用吧。不然的话，可以先免费申请一个。Hello软件唯一的不足是不支持中文聊天。当然，安装在中文系统上是绝对没有问题的
使用该服务以前，必须先下载Hello软件，这是一个能够方便的与朋友分享图片的软件，据它说，要比email、网站等分享来的更简单，速度也更快。同时，它和Blogger.com合作，内置了BloggerBot。 用户可以实现设定好所略图的格式，在Hello中，登录Blogger.com，选中图片，加上文字，点击发布，然后就可以看到图片被很好的剪裁并发布到Blog中了

There are a variety of nightlife options in Busan for every budget in every part of the city. Names can be a little misleading, but there are a few general rules. The following attempts a brief description of the types of joints you can expect to find. At the bottom of the page are reviews of some popular nightspots. In many parts of the city, you can find big Nightclubs in the Korean style. This usually means you are expected to have a table, and usually must order anju (side dishes) with your drinks. They tend to insist on proper dress (no tank tops, ratty clothes, etc.) and tend to be a bit pricey. Sometimes they have lip-synch bands, 'animators', or some other stage entertainment. There is of course a lot of dancing, usually with the people you came with although it is possible to meet people. The Korean nightclub scene, like the general social scene in Korea, leans toward established groups and not so much free mingling as Westerners may be accustomed to. Feel it out. There have been cases of foreigners being ejected from nightclubs for dressing too 'down' or being a little too aggressive in their social advances. On the other hand, you can meet many Koreans who will be happy to make a new friend, buy you a drink, or spin around the floor with you. A Soju Bang (pronounced 'bahng') is a place to sit down and drink Soju (or beer). Many expect you to order anju, but even if they don't, you may want to consider having something in your stomach anyway. These are good places to get pickled cheaply. A westerner pounding Soju at a Soju bang rarely fails to impress. Be prepared to speak some Korean (and maybe make some local friends). A Hof (sometimes transliterated as 'HOP') is similar to a Soju Bang except that they have draft beer and different food options. Usually fairly cheap. Also a good place for a quiet night of drinking with friends and locals. These, like Soju bangs, can be found virtually everywhere in Busan. Pojang Macha (literally 'covered wagon', lovingly called 'Soju Tent' by foreigners) can be described as an outdoor Soju Bang. These are great places to hang out when the weather is nice, especially out at the beach. In winter, they zip down the flaps and turn on the space heater, and can still be very cozy. They will expect you to order anju with your drinks and are a bit more expensive than soju bangs, however the food options can be more exotic (whale meat, live octopus, fresh shellfish, and my personal favorite, chicken gizzards). These can be found singly around the city, and they are concentrated in certain areas like Haeundae (beachfront) and Seomyeon (behind Lotte Hotel). In some places, notably Texas Street, there are merely carts with little or no cover, so you are sitting in the open air. Soju al fresco!
